newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss PTT contests cartel ruling on Internet link.
newsitem.headline: Swiss PTT contests cartel ruling on Internet link.

text.p: The Swiss telecoms provider Telecom PTT said it would contest a ruling by Swiss cartel authorities that its Internet access provider "Blue Window" had temporarily received cross-subsidies.

"The Telecom PTT vigorously rejects the accusation that, with its online service Blue Window, it discriminated against private Internet providers and thus violated the cartel laws," the PTT said in a statement.
The state-owned telecoms provider, which plans a partial privatisation in 1998, denied it engaged in anti-competitive activities during Blue Window's start-up phase last year.
Swiss cartel authorities, in a statement on Friday, said Telecom had enjoyed an unfair advantage versus private Interet access providers during the start-up phase last September.
But it added that the advantage no longer existed and that no further measures were called for.
It also said that it remained up to the private providers whether to seek any damages in civil courts.
The cartel authorities said the decision was based on its investigation which followed complaints by private Internet providers about unfair practices last year.
The authorities said the Telecom PTT had assumed a double role as a monoply in the telecommunications sector and as an Internet provider with its service Blue Window.
"In the centre of the investigations was the question whether the Telecom PTT misused this double role in the sense of the cartel law," the cartel office said.

The Swiss PTT, according to the cartel authorities, temporarily created an unfair advantage by providing Internet access based on cheaper local telephone charges via its access number 0-842. Blue Window paid the difference between the local number and more expensive long-distance rates.
The cartel office ruled that competitors were improperly informed about access to the advantageous 0-842 number and the PTT at least temporarily provided cross-subsidies.
